result.execSummary:
All charges against Halie D Erickson in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Halie D Erickson is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:37 PM Defendant Halie D Erickson in court, in custody.  Attorney Bradley J Jansen in court for Halie D Erickson.  Attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. Judge Galen Bayne-Allison appears via Portage County Branch 3 Zoom and Marathon County Br 2 Zoom.
Cases 21CF290, 22CF346, 21CF83, and 21CF100 are assigned to Judge Galen Bayne-Allison.  Cases 22CF439, 22CF440, and 22CF441 Judge is able to hear these cases as well.
Plea Questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement and requests a Pre-Sentence Investigation Report (PSI).
Attorney for defendant concurs with agreement stated and the request for a PSI.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
21CF39 Count 1, 3, 5, 7, & 9 - Guilty
21CF83 Count 1, 2, & 3 - Guilty
21CF100 Count 1 - Guilty
Court questions defendant regarding plea.
Court informs defendant of the constitutional rights. 
Court advises defendant of elements the state must prove for the charge.
Court questions attorney for the defendant.
Court finds defendant's plea is freely, voluntarily, knowingly, and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty of
21CF39 Count 1, 3, 5, 7, & 9
21CF83 Count 1, 2, & 3
21CF100 Count 1

Clerk directed to enter judgment of conviction(s) this date.
22CF346 is dismissed outright.
21CF290, 21CF83 Count 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, & 8, and 21CF39 Counts 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 11, 12, 13, & 14 are dismissed and read in.
Cases 22CF439, 22CF440, and 22CF441 are dismissed and read in.
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Victims are not present.

BY THE COURT:
Court will order a PSI Investigation
PSI to be delivered to all parties by 1 week prior to hearing.
Bond Continued
Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 6, 2023 at 10:30 am.

10:47 AM Defendant Haley D Erickson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of WI.  Atty Taylor Soule appears on behalf of the defendant.

ADA Dodge states facts for anticipated charges of Possession & Deliver of Methamphetamine.
Co-defendant with Jordan E Krueger.

Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Defendant is eligible for public defender representation.
Atty Erickson is currently represented by counsel.
Court questions defendant. 

State requests a $2,500 signature bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Soule does not have any objections as to bond. 
Court sets a $2,500 signature bond with conditions as stated on the record.
Hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
